intro: Hieracium glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, producing yellow daisy-like blooms. Hieracium glabrescens is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread rapidly through its rhizomatous growth.
